Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: Since you've been working on it, I didn't mention the issue I've found where restarting a node lets PoS kick ass where previously "stalled" (which I think is related to the way diff looks back over time)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think I have fixed that already by fixing another issue

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The problem was that segid isnt set in block index properly

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: yeah, that's why I didn't mention it, I figured I'd wait and see if it still applied after you do what you're doing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: When you restart the entire blockindex cache is wiped clean as its not saved to disk. But as soon as segid is called, it sets the flag in block index again. It means that its not their for the entire chain, after a restart, but it *should* now populate teh blockindex flag the firs time it checks that block.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the `getlastsegidstakes` RPC will set the entire index if you call it for the whole chain once... then the next tiem you call it its instant response.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So I beleive its working fine.
